intro: Psychotria haumugaensis, commonly known as the Haumugua Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
